Isaac Funk to Abraham Lincoln and Edward D. Baker, 1 March 1849 myself together with all thewhigsof Bloomington are exceedingly anxious to have an honest man for Postmaster at thisplaceand I wish to ask of you as a special favor to myself and your friends here that

you have appointedHazo Parsons—he is competent—old— poor— and lame & has a large family and is unable to labor and

it is the general wish of the whigs of this place that he should be appointed— We

have been to long cursed with the post office here that we now feel anxious to have

a good postmaster as it is all the whigs here expect to ask they think they have a

right to thisany thing you can do in this behalf will be gratefully acknowledged by your
